Dear Derrick McCree:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a corrective action plan is required. The corrective action
plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter, must be completed and routed in CWLM,
and must include the following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Samantha Way at 517-243-9743.

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions
Title
1

Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth A was assaulted by Staff 2, but details of the assault are
unknown. Two months ago, Youth A was slapped by Staff 1, but
further details are unknown.
Investigation Complainant was interviewed over the phone with MDHHS
worker on 1/29/2025. Complainant did not have any further
information.
Youth A was interviewed at the facility with MDHHS worker on
1/27/2025 and again on 3/21/25 at the facility. Youth A stated he
felt comfortable around staff. When asked if any staff has done
something to him since he has been placed, Youth A nodded his
head yes. Youth A did not answer any further questions. Youth A
got out of his seat and began banging his head on the facility wall
until another staff intervened, and Youth A walked out. Youth A
reported he has never had an issue with Staff 1. He reported on
the day of the incident, Staff 2 threatened to slap him, but he did
not physically assault him.
Therapist was interviewed at the facility with MDHHS worker
on 1/27/2025. Therapist is aware of an incident between Staff 2
and Youth A regarding Youth A trying to throw his urine on Staff 2.
He has not disclosed to her any issues with staff. She reported
that she is unaware of Staff 1 or Staff assaulting/slapping Youth A.
Chief Administrator was interviewed at the facility with
MDHHS worker on 1/27/2025. He stated Staff 2 has been
suspended pending the outcome of the investigation. He stated
that he is unaware of Staff 1 or Staff 2 assaulting/slapping Youth
A.
Youth B was interviewed at the facility with MDHHS worker on
1/27/2025. He reported that he has not observed any staff or
youth harming Youth A. Youth B did not recall any incidents
involving Youth A with Staff 1 or Staff 2. He is not aware of Staff 1
or Staff 2 assaulting/slapping Youth A.
2

Youth C was interviewed at the facility with MDHHS worker on
1/27/2025. Youth C reported he has not observed staff being
inappropriate, but Youth A does try to fight and threaten staff.
Youth C is not familiar with Staff 1. He reported he has never had
any issues with Staff 2. Youth C reported that he is not aware of
Staff 1 or Staff 2 assaulting/slapping Youth A.
Staff 1 was interviewed at the facility with MDHHS worker on
1/27/2025. Staff 1 reported that he works the day shift. He has
never put his hands on Youth A or has ever restrained him. He
stated that he would be fired if he slapped Youth A. He is not
aware of Staff 2 assaulting Youth A. He has not observed Staff 2
being inappropriate with any youth.
Youth D was interviewed at the facility with MDHHS worker on
1/27/2025. Youth D reported that he is not aware of Staff 1 or Staff
2 assaulting/slapping Youth A.
Staff 2 was interviewed at the facility with MDHHS worker on
1/29/2025. Staff 2 reported on the day of the incident, Youth A
was on suicide watch. Youth A does not like it when male staff
watch him, and he prefers the female staff. He did not have an
issue with Youth A prior to this incident. As Staff 2 was sitting
outside of Youth A’s room, Youth A asked to come out of his room
but was told no. Youth A began banging his head against the wall
and was told by Staff 4 that if he continued to bang his head, she
will close his door. Youth A told staff that he will “pour piss all over
them”. Youth A returned to banging his head against the wall,
turned toward Staff 2 and proceeded to urinate on the floor. Staff 2
immediately closed his door, and urine began to run from under
his door. Staff 2 stated Youth A was in his room for no more than
15 minutes. Staff 2 called for a supervisor on the walkie. Staff 2
stated he wasn’t trained on how to react to situations but was only
told to not physically but their hands on youth. He has heard of
Youth A throwing urine on a different staff. Staff 2 is not familiar
with Staff 1. Staff 2 reported that he did not assault Youth A.
Staff 3 was interviewed at the facility with MDHHS worker on
1/29/2025. Staff 3 was present on the day of the incident with
Youth A. Staff 3 reported Youth A does not like when male staff
watch him on suicide watch. She heard Youth A say to Staff 2 that
he will throw urine on him. She walked away for five minutes and
upon her return, she saw urine on the floor and a supervisor was
called on the walkie. Staff 2 was removed from the situation, and
she sat with Youth A. Youth A told her that Staff 2 told Youth A
that he was going to slap him, but she did not personally hear that.
3

She has not heard Staff 2 speak that way to youth. She believed it
was Staff 2 first time on suicide watch, and he may not have been
properly trained on the protocol. She is not aware of Staff 1
slapping Youth A. She works the same shift with Staff 1, and he
interacts with youth often. Youth A will tell her things that occurred
when she is off from work, and he did not report of Staff 1 slapping
him.
Staff 4 was interviewed at the facility with MDHHS worker on
1/29/2025. Staff 4 was in her office when she heard the
commotion regarding Youth A urinating outside of his door. When
she stepped out of her office and saw Manager 1 handling the
situation, she went back into her office and did not see anything
else. She did not hear Staff 2 say he will slap Youth A. She also
did not hear of anyone saying they will slap Youth A. She was not
aware of any incident between Staff 1 and Youth A. Staff 4
reported Staff 1 is the only staff who can calm down Youth A.
Manager 1 was interviewed at the facility with MDHHS worker
on 1/29/2025. Manager 1 stated he was called down to Pod 2 and
Youth A was urinating outside of his door. Staff 2 was upset
because Youth A tried to urinate on him. Manager 1 did not
observe Staff 2 hitting Youth A or verbally assaulting him. He is
not aware of any incident with Staff 1 and Youth A.
Staff 6 was interviewed at the facility with MDHHS worker on
1/29/2025. Staff 6 reported she has no concerns with Staff 2
noting she has only worked with him once. She is not aware of
Staff 1 assaulting/slapping Youth A.
Staff 7 was interviewed at the facility with MDHHS worker on
1/29/2025. Staff 7 reported she saw Staff 2 near Youth A’s door.
She did not have sight of the incident due to where she was
sitting. She did not hear Staff 2 say he was going to slap Youth A.
She did see the urine on the floor from Youth A. She has not
observed Staff 1 slapping Youth A. She has only witnessed good
interactions with Staff 1 and other youth.
Nurse 1 was interviewed at the facility with MDHHS worker on
1/29/2025. There are no medical reports of staff slapping Youth A.
She is not aware of Staff 1 or Staff 2 assaulting/slapping Youth A.
Video Reviewed:
The video reviewed from 1/23/2025 shows Staff 2 sitting outside
of Youth A’s room with the door open. Staff 2 jumps up from his
seat and closes Youth A’s door. Staff 3 comes into frame.
4

Manager 1 moves Staff 2 off the pod and Staff 3 cleans up the
urine on the floor. Staff 2 does not engage at all with Youth A or
enter his room. Youth A remains in his room throughout the entire
video. There is no audio.
Documentation Reviewed:
• Incident report dated 1/23/2025 noted: Staff 2 was
completing one-on-one suicide watch with Youth A with his
door ajar. Youth A threatened to throw urine on Staff 2.
Staff 2 closed Youth A’s door at 9:16am. Staff 2 requested
Staff 4 to the location. Staff 4 arrived on the scene to assist
with cleaning the area as Youth urinated by the door. Staff
2 continued to hold line-of-sight. Youth A’s door was
reopened at 9:40am.
• Staff training logs for Staff 1. Staff 1 completed Discipline
Policies & Procedures on 7/5/2024, Crisis Intervention –
Verbal De-escalation & Physical Practicum on 7/1/2024
and 7/2/2024, and MANDT trainings on 8/23/2024 and
9/26/2024.
• Staff training logs for Staff 2. Staff 2 completed Discipline
Policies & Procedures on 12/13/2024 and Crisis
Intervention – Verbal De-escalation & Physical Practicum
on 12/9/2024 and 12/10/2024.
• Staff 1’s personnel file – no disciplinary record.
• Staff 2’s personnel file – 1 disciplinary record not related to
allegation.
• Verbal Intervention and Physical Intervention policy
prohibits any type of physical discipline.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance as per youth and staff
interviews, video footage and other documentation there is no
evidence of Staff 1 and Staff 2, slapping or assaulting Youth A.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(iv) Verbal abuse including the use of derogatory or
discriminatory language including negative references to a youth's
background or appearance or mental state. Yelling, threats,
ridicule, or humiliation are strictly prohibited.
5

Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth A is being verbally assaulted by staff. Staff 8 called Youth A
"turtle boy". Staff 8 told Youth A he was going to slap the "f" out of
him if he threw urine on a staff member.
Investigation Complainant was interviewed over the phone with MDHHS
worker on 1/29/2025. Complainant did not have any further
information.
Youth A was interviewed at the facility with MDHHS worker on
1/27/2025 and 3/21/2025 at the facility. Youth A stated he felt
comfortable around staff. When asked if any staff has done
something to him since he has been here, Youth A nodded his
head yes. Youth A did not answer any further questions. Youth A
got out of his seat and began banging his head on the facility wall
until another staff intervened, and Youth A walked out. He stated
he was called turtle boy by a staff, but he does not remember who
it was. He reported on the day of the incident, Staff 2 threatened
to slap him, but he did not physically assault him.
Therapist was interviewed at the facility with MDHHS worker
on 1/27/2025. She is not aware of Staff 8 calling Youth A turtle
boy or saying he will slap the “f” out of him.
Chief Administrator was interviewed at the facility with
MDHHS worker on 1/27/2025. Chief Administrator reported Staff
8 was terminated over a month ago and would not have been
present for the incident in question on 1/23/2025. He is not aware
of Staff 8 calling Youth A turtle boy or saying he will slap the “f” out
of him.
Youth B was interviewed at the facility with MDHHS worker on
1/27/2025. He reported he has not observed any staff being
inappropriate or using profanity. Youth B stated Staff 1 is
professional and has not observed him using profanity. He does
not know who Staff 8 is.
Youth C was interviewed at the facility with MDHHS worker on
1/27/2025. Youth C reported he has not observed staff being
inappropriate. Youth C is not familiar with Staff 8. He has heard of
staff using profanity but does not recall their name or incident.
Staff 1 was interviewed at the facility with MDHHS worker on
1/27/2025. He does not know who Staff 8 is, but Youth D also has
the same name as Staff 8.
6

Youth D was interviewed at the facility with MDHHS worker on
1/27/2025. Youth D reported he has heard staff swear at Youth A
but he does not know their names and it does not happen often.
He reported that he does not know who Staff 8 is.
Staff 2 was interviewed at the facility with MDHHS worker on
1/29/2025. Does not know who Staff 8 is. He has not heard staff
call Youth A “turtle boy” but has heard other youth call Youth A the
name.
Staff 3 was interviewed at the facility with MDHHS worker on
1/29/2025. Staff 3 was present on the day of the incident with
Youth A. Youth A told her Staff 2 told Youth A that he was going to
slap him, but she did not personally hear that. She has not heard
Staff 2 speak that way to youth. She reported she heard Youth D
tell Youth A that he will “slap the “f” out of him”. Staff 3 reported
she does not know who Staff 8 is.
Staff 4 was interviewed at the facility with MDHHS worker on
1/29/2025. Staff 4 heard the commotion regarding Youth A
urinating outside of his door. She did not hear Staff 2 say he will
slap Youth A. She also did not hear of anyone saying they will
slap Youth A. She does not know who Staff 8 is.
Manager 1 was interviewed at the facility with MDHHS worker
on 1/29/2025. Manager 1 stated he was called down to Pod 2 and
Youth A was urinating outside of his door. Staff 2 was upset
because Youth A was tried to urinate on him. Manager 1 did not
observe Staff 2 hitting Youth A or verbally assaulting him.
Manager 1 is not aware of Staff 8 calling Youth A turtle boy or
saying he will slap the “f” out of him.
Staff 6 was interviewed at the facility with MDHHS worker on
1/29/2025. Staff 6 reported that she does not know who Staff 8 is.
Staff 7 was interviewed at the facility with MDHHS worker on
1/29/2025. Staff 7 reported that she is not familiar with who Staff 8
is.
Staff 8 was interviewed over the phone on 4/1/2025. Staff 8
reported his last day working at Calumet was on 12/16/2024. He
reported he is familiar with Youth A, but he did not call him turtle
boy or threatened to slap him. He is not aware of staff calling
Youth A “turtle boy”. He is also not aware of youth calling Youth A
“turtle boy”. Staff 8 reported he is not aware of staff verbally or
physically threatening Youth A.
7

Video Reviewed:
The video reviewed from 1/23/2025 has no audio.
Documentation Reviewed:
• Staff 8 training log noted Staff 8 completed Discipline &
Police Procedures on 12/13/2024, and Crisis Intervention –
Verbal De-escalation & Physical Practicum on 12/9/2024
and 12/10/2024.
• Prohibited Conduct Policy states unprofessional conduct
and use of abusive or threatening language by staff are
prohibited.
• Staff 2’s personnel file – 1 disciplinary record not related to
allegation.
• Staff 8’s personnel file – no disciplinary record.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance as per youth and staff
interviews, and documentation reviewed staff and youth are not
aware of who Staff 8 is. Staff 8 and Youth D have the same name
and may have caused confusion with the allegation. There is no
evidence that Staff 2 threatened to slap Youth A.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code Seclusion within secure and nonsecure facilities; seclusion plan;
Title prohibitions; reduction and elimination.
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4162
Section (11) All seclusion will be prohibited effective November 1, 2022.
Description
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Youth A was secluded in his room for 24 minutes and the
seclusion was unwarranted.
Investigation Youth A was interviewed at the facility on 3/21/2025. He stated
he does not recall how long he was in his room after Staff 2 closed
it and Staff 4 opened. Youth A reported the door was closed due
to him urinating while Staff 2 was supervising him on suicide
watch.
Staff 2 was interviewed over the phone on 3/28/2025. Staff 2
reported Youth A was secluded in his for no more than 15
minutes. He does not recall the exact amount of time.
Video Reviewed:
8

The video reviewed from 1/23/2025 shows Staff 2 sitting outside
of Youth A’s room with the door open. Staff 2 jumps up from his
seat and closes Youth A’s door. Staff 3 comes into frame.
Manager 1 moves Staff 2 off the pod and Staff 3 cleans up the
urine on the floor. Staff 2 does not engage at all with Youth A or
enter his room. Youth A remains in his room throughout the entire
video. There is no audio.
Documentation Reviewed:
• Incident report dated 1/23/2025 noted: Staff 2 was
completing one-on-one suicide watch with Youth A with his
door ajar. Youth A threatened to throw urine on Staff 2.
Staff 2 closed Youth A’s door at 9:16am. Staff 2 requested
Staff 4 to the location. Staff 4 arrived on the scene to assist
with cleaning the area as Youth urinated by the door. Staff
2 continued to hold line-of-sight. Youth A’s door was
reopened at 9:40am.
• Calumet Seclusion Variance states that staff must only use
seclusion as a temporary response to prevent life-
threatening injury or serious bodily harm when other
interventions are ineffective.
Analysis The agency is found in non-compliance as during interviews,
documentation and video reviewed, Youth A was secluded in his
room for 24 minutes due to urinating toward staff. This was
unwarranted as this was not a response to a life-threatening injury
or serious bodily harm when other interventions were ineffective
and doesn’t align with seclusion variance granted.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established
SIR #2024SIC0001619 dated 7/25/24, CAP approved 3/11/25
SIR #2025SIC0000004 dated 10/2/24, CAP approved 1/24/25
9

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
